name: Styn Vercauteren
intro1: Hallo! Ik ben een medior frontend developer met een bachelor Toegepaste Informatica. Deze heb ik behaald op KDG.
intro2: At 26, I've already gained valuable work and academic experience in test-driven, agile website development. I have improved my skills at Calqi, Two Point O, Oddball / Purple Panda and DXC FDS.
intro3: I have around 3.5 years of working experience.

blockCalqi.title: Calqi
blockCalqi.text1: Calqi is a startup aimed at architects. As the sole full-time developer,I was responsible for modernizing the application.
blockCalqi.text2: This role challenged me to expand my technical skills, particularly in handling a complex legacy codebase with a lot of responsability.
blockCalqi.text3: At Calqi, I contributed to modernizing the application, improving its maintainability and performance. While the company required deeper PHP expertise, they valued my contributions and the improvements I implemented. This experience strengthened my ability to quickly adapt, work independently, and take ownership of technical challenges.

blockTwoPointO.title: Two Point O
blockTwoPointO.text1: I worked at Two Point O as a frontend developer. However, this was shortlived due to this job not being a complete match after all.

beat.title: Be•at
beat.description: I contributed to a new project for the company behind the Sportpaleis, working on development for a month. The project is still in progress

beamery.title: Beamery
beamery.description: I contributed to the redesign of Beamery's website, improving UI/UX and performanc

troubleshootingPage.title: POC troubleshooting page
troubleshootingPage.description: I developed an internal troubleshooting page for the company website. This page helps customers diagnose technical issues by displaying system specifications.

poc.title: POC
poc.description: Lastly I co-developed two proof-of-concept projects for potential future initiatives.

blockOddball.title: Oddball / Purple Panda
blockOddball.text1: I worked as a Frontend Developer at Oddball, which later merged with Purple Panda.
blockOddball.text2: I started as part of a four-member team and eventually took on the responsibility of leading the team independently. Specializing in React development, I also gained experience deploying websites on Google Cloud.
blockOddball.text3: I co-developed 3 websites from scratch, seeing them through to completion, ensuring high performance and user-friendly experiences.

tvc.title: TheValueChain
tvc.description: We developed the website for Gumption’s largest company, creating reusable components, fixing bugs, and handling change requests post-launch.

brightest.title: Brightest
brightest.description: We also built the website for Gumption’s second-largest company, utilizing a similar tech stack and development process as TheValueChain.

linc.title: Linc.legal
linc.description: Lastly we also designed and developed a website for this Antwerp-based law firm, maintaining consistency in technology and best practices across projects.

blockOddball.technologies: All of these websites use these technologies:
blockOddball.responsibility: It was also my responsibility for the go-live. This includes deploying the website and configuring DNS.

blockDXC.title: DXC FDS
blockDXC.text1: My first paid working experience was as a consultant for the Flemish Government. I spent the first year modernizing the Gebruikersbeheer which is the internal authorization panel by converting legacy code into microservices, improving maintainability and scalability.
blockDXC.text2: After that, I co-developed the Inzageloket for Department Omgeving, a public-facing website which enables civilians to view nearby construction projects on a map.
blockDXC.text3: I started on the backend in a five-person team before transitioning to frontend development, working closely with a senior developer to enhance UI functionality.

blockInternship.title: Internship icapps
blockInternship.text: I concluded my academic journey with an 8-week internship at an agency, where I worked in a duo to develop a CMS-based website for a furniture store.
blockInternship.text2: As part of the team, we received frontend and backend support when needed. The project followed an agile workflow, including regular client demos to ensure alignment with their needs.

block1.title: KDG
block1.text1: Bachelor's Degree in Applied Informatics, Karel de Grote-hogeschool
block1.text2: I graduated with a focus on agile software development methodologies, gaining valuable experience in teamwork and professional software development.

block2.title: Udemy
block2.text1: To keep pace with the latest technologies, I have successfully completed three courses on Udemy, earning certificates upon completion.

block1.title: Independent Art Magazine
block1.text: Galerij Artisjok in Lier asked me to create a website for their newest magazine. I took on this project in my free time, developing it independently using only non-paid services.
block1.text3: A frontend integrated with a CMS for easy content management
block1.text5: A dynamic grid with randomized tile
block1.text6: A photo gallery with a slider and Instagram integration
block1.text7: You can find the source code here

block2.title: React Brussels
block2.text: I had the opportunity to volunteer at React Brussels, which allowed me to connect with many skilled professionals and attend insightful talks and workshops.
block2.text2:
During the event, I had my first experience with Astroand learned how to use server components for forms, a feature introduced in React 19.
I also attended sessions on accessibility, AI, and view transitions, gaining valuable insights into modern web development practices.
